qas.question: In what year was it announced that the Shell Group would move to a single capital structure?
What was the name of the Shell Group's new parent company?
On what exchange was the Shell Group's new parent company primarily listed?
Where was the Royal Dutch Shell plc headquartered?
What was the cause of the period of turmoil prior to the announcement that the Shell Group would move to a single capital structure?

answers.text: the revelation that Shell had been overstating its oil reserves

qas.question: When was it discovered Shell had been overstating its oil reserves?
When was Shell listed on the LSE?
When was Royal Dutch Petroleum added to the NYSE?
Contrary to the original ownership, shareholders were given what disadvantage of the Shell group?
What Netherlands city housed the registered office?

context: In <b5_0>November <a0_0>2004<b5_0/><a0_0/>, following a period of turmoil caused by <a4_0>the revelation that Shell had been overstating its oil reserves<a4_0/>, it was announced that the Shell Group would move to a single capital structure, creating a new parent company to be named <a1_0>Royal Dutch Shell plc<a1_0/>, with its primary listing on <a2_0>the London Stock Exchange<a2_0/>, a secondary listing on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange, its headquarters and tax residency in <a3_0>The Hague, Netherlands<a3_0/> and its registered office in <b9_0>London<b9_0/>. The unification was completed on 20 July 2005 and the original owners delisted their companies from the respective exchanges. On <b6_0>20 July 2005<b6_0/>, the Shell Transport & Trading Company plc was delisted from the LSE, where as, Royal Dutch Petroleum Company from NYSE on <b7_0>18 November 2005<b7_0/>. The shares of the company were issued at a <b8_0>60/40<b8_0/> advantage for the shareholders of Royal Dutch in line with the original ownership of the Shell Group.
